IBM i2 Intelligence Analysis Platform SDK API

Welcome to the IBM(R) i2 Intelligence Analysis Platform SDK API documentation.

This documentation is aimed at developers who are customizing and extending the Intelligence Analysis Platform. It also describes the API of the Java client.

See:
          Description

Data
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.transport Contains classes for communicating information between the services that are responsible for data access on-demand solutions in the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport Contains classes and interfaces for communicating data with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.
com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.factory Contains factory classes for creating item data, for use in commands that are issued to the Intelligence Analysis Platform command service.
com.i2group.apollo.model.provenance.transport Contains classes for communicating provenance information with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema.transport.unchecked Contains a class for communicating unchecked data with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.
com.i2group.apollo.model.security.transport Contains classes for communicating security information with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.

 

Schema
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema Contains enumerations that enable you to identify system-defined item and property types programmatically, and interfaces that provide domain-specific representations of geospatial values.
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema.builder Contains interfaces for creating and converting geospatial property values for use in Analysis Repository items.
com.i2group.apollo.model.schema.transport Contains classes for communicating schema information with Intelligence Analysis Platform services.

 

Events
com.i2group.apollo.cqrs Contains interfaces for interacting with the Intelligence Analysis Platform's JMS event bus.
com.i2group.apollo.events.transport Contains classes for the events that commands can fire, as well as classes and interfaces that define changes to the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.events.transport.factory Contains factory classes for creating change information, for use in commands that are issued to the Intelligence Analysis Platform command service.

 

Common Functionality
com.i2group.apollo.common Contains classes and interfaces that code throughout the Intelligence Analysis Platform uses.
com.i2group.apollo.common.tracing Contains an interface that provides utilities for tracing code execution.
com.i2group.apollo.service.common Contains interfaces and classes that all the standard Intelligence Analysis Platform services use.
com.i2group.tracing Contains an interface that provides access to log4j tracing functionality.

 

Command Service
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform command service provides clients with the ability to execute commands that make changes to data, and to manage the leases that help determine which commands a particular client can execute at a given moment in time.
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice.transport Contains classes and interfaces for commands that make changes to data in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.commandservice.transport.factory Contains factory classes for creating commands that are issued to the Intelligence Analysis Platform command service.

 

Search Service
com.i2group.apollo.searchservice The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform search service provides clients with the ability to perform searches of various types against the latest versions of data, and to retrieve scored search results.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.searchservice.transport Contains classes for the services that search for items in the Analysis Repository and external data sources.

 

Network Search Service
com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform network search service provides clients with the ability to perform network searches of various types against the latest versions of data, and to retrieve scored search results.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.networksearchservice.transport Contains classes for the services that perform network searches for items in the Analysis Repository and external data sources.

 

Index Admin Service
com.i2group.apollo.indexadminservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform index admin service provides clients with the ability to take a snapshot of the search index that can be backed up without being affected by simultaneous changes being made to the index.

 

Item Retrieval Service
com.i2group.apollo.itemretrievalservice The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform item retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve any version of any stored item, alone or in groups, in a variety of ways.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.

 

Item History Service
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice The standard Intelligence Analysis Platform item history service provides clients with the ability to look at the changes that items have undergone as a result of edit and merge operations. The service also enables clients to examine the differences between two versions of an item.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.itemhistoryservice.transport Contains classes for the service that reports on changes to items in the Analysis Repository.

 

Purge Service
com.i2group.apollo.purgeservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform purge service provides clients with the ability to remove all trace of items and sets from the Analysis Repository.

 

Administration Service
com.i2group.apollo.adminservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform admin service provides clients with the ability to perform administrative functions on the whole system.

 

Audit Service
com.i2group.apollo.auditservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform audit service provides clients with the ability to retrieve audit information about changes to items in the Analysis Repository.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.auditservice.transport Contains classes for the service that retrieves audit entries about items in the Analysis Repository.

 

Alert Feed Service
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform alert feed service provides clients with the ability to create, subscribe to, and unsubscribe from alert feeds in the Analysis Repository.
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedservice.transport Contains classes for the service that creates alert feeds in the Analysis Repository.

 

Alert Retrieval Service
com.i2group.apollo.alertretrievalservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform alert retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve the alerts generated by alert feeds.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.alertretrievalservice.transport Contains classes for the service that retrieves alerts about items in the Analysis Repository.

 

Alert Feed Retrieval Service
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedretrievalservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform alert feed retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve alert feeds and determine which ones they are subscribed to.

Calls to methods in this service must include a SOAP header containing an element named <ApolloMetadata> with an attribute named TimeZone. The value of the TimeZone attribute indicates the time zone that the client requires dates and times to be sent and displayed in.
com.i2group.apollo.alertfeedretrievalservice.transport Contains classes for the service that retrieves alert feeds from the Analysis Repository.

 

Information Service
com.i2group.apollo.infoservice The Intelligence Analysis Platform info service provides clients with a variety of functionality that is relevant to the whole system.
com.i2group.apollo.infoservice.transport Contains classes for the service that provides system-wide information for the Intelligence Analysis Platform.

 

External Data Services
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.retrievalservice An Intelligence Analysis Platform external data retrieval service provides clients with the ability to retrieve live information from an external data provider that has already been the subject of data acquisition.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.subsetcreationservice An Intelligence Analysis Platform external data subset creation service provides users with the ability to perform search and expand operations against an appropriately configured external data provider through the Intelligence Portal user interface.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.subsetexplorationservice An Intelligence Analysis Platform external data subset exploration service provides clients with the ability to retrieve information from a subset of data that has been created from an external data provider.

 

File Upload and Download
com.i2group.apollo.documentstore Contains functionality for downloading files from, and uploading files to, the Intelligence Analysis Platform document store.

 

Extension Points
com.i2group.apollo.alertingapi Contains a custom extension point relating to alerting.
com.i2group.apollo.itemstoreapi Contains interfaces for simple interactions with the event bus and the item store from server-side code.
com.i2group.apollo.securityapi Contains custom extension points relating to security.
com.i2group.apollo.service.loggingapi Contains custom extension points relating to logging.

 

Supplied Implementations
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata Contains a supplied implementation of an external data subset locator that creates the subset to which it also provides access.
com.i2group.apollo.security Contains a supplied implementation of a principal provider that maps dimension values to WebSphere roles.
com.i2group.apollo.useractivitylogger Contains a supplied implementation of a user activity logger that performs no logging.

 

Data Acquisition
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.adapter Contains an interface whose methods can be called by an external data subset creation service or an external data subset locator to retrieve data from an external data source.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.connector Contains interfaces for locating, retrieving, and modifying the contents of an external data subset before the items in the subset are returned to clients.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.edrs Contains classes and interfaces for retrieving data directly from an external data source in a Data Acquisition project.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.loader Contains interfaces and implementing classes for creating and managing items from an external data source in the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.typeconversion Contains classes that allow code in a Data Acquisition project to make changes to data that has been retrieved from an external data source.

 

Client
com.i2group.apollo.client Contains interfaces and a class for interacting with the Intelligence Analysis Platform through the supplied Java client.
com.i2group.apollo.client.handlers Contains classes and interfaces that provide access to information that is communicated between the supplied Java client and the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
com.i2group.apollo.rest Contains a class that enables REST resources to create and interact with external data retrieval and subset exploration services.

 

SDK
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.retrievalservice.sdk Contains a factory class for creating Intelligence Analysis Platform external data retrieval services.
com.i2group.apollo.externaldata.subsetexplorationservice.sdk Contains a factory class for creating Intelligence Analysis Platform external data subset exploration services.

 

Welcome to the IBM(R) i2 Intelligence Analysis Platform SDK API documentation.

This documentation is aimed at developers who are customizing and extending the Intelligence Analysis Platform. It also describes the API of the Java client.

The Intelligence Analysis Platform demonstrates command and query responsibility segregation (CQRS). An Intelligence Analysis Platform web service can modify (write) data or query (read) it, but never both. This design is reflected in the following diagram:

The design has a number of consequences for the Intelligence Analysis Platform:

  • Responsibility for creating, updating, and deleting data is separated into data-writing services that are independent from the services that read data. The data-writing services communicate changes to the read services through a system-wide event bus.
  • The command service, which is a data-writing service, has the following responsibilities:
    • Validating commands according to Intelligence Analysis Platform rules
    • Converting valid commands to Intelligence Analysis Platform events
    • Placing events in the event store and onto the event bus
  • The event store is an audit trail that contains information about every command and purge request (successfully) issued to the Intelligence Analysis Platform. Each event also records which user issued the request, when they issued it, and where (that is, what IP address) they issued it from.
  • Any read service, new or old, can be started or brought back up to date by replaying the event store onto the event bus.
  • The Intelligence Analysis Platform does not use a single store for all data. Instead, read services maintain their own data stores that provide optimum performance for their particular needs. Read services populate these data stores in response to the events they receive. They are free to act upon or ignore events as their function requires.
  • The delay between events generation on the write side and reception on the read side means that there is latency between the two. This latency is typically not noticeable to users, but Intelligence Analysis Platform clients must be robust to its possible effects.
